content:
4, 2015
												I am somehwat twisted in regards to this game after having picked it up in the most recent sale.First things first it has a lot of flat out amazing components. Right now I feel like Crysis graphics are in a sweet spot since they are, ahead of their time as they were 8 years ago still great but, finally achievable on midrange computers like mione. FYI I played on a an overclocked intel pentium g3258 and an r9 280 and fas more than pleased with the results. The gunplay and gameplay generally are definitely top notch. One of the strongest points of the game is, the way it appears to me, that it offers a surprisingly high amount of replayability with different approaches, such as relying more on stealth, sniping or throwing. This wide range of possibilities in game coupled with a lot of destroyability makes up for an shooter that even after some years is unsurpassed in certain regards. The story may at times appear incohesive  but is most definitely one of epic scale.Despite all that i was for a moment on the verge of not recommending Crysis for pretty much just one reason. Bugs and glitches. During the last mission it occured to me not once not twice but over 20 times that I glitched through the floor to either die or get stuck. Afterwards I also crashed various times which allegedly madddened me a good bit more than I care to admit here. Those are however experiences that may have been individual to me. It may be, that you get to play this title without anything of that kind happening to you even once, leaving you with a 10/10 title.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
ry 21, 2015
												While Crysis' story was never really anything special to begin with, it certainly gets the job done. It takes some unexpected twists and turns along the way, and it does lead to a fairly interesting conclusion, but all in all it's clear that this is a game of gameplay over story. If you want something with a story that will rival franchises like Half-Life or Bioshock, you're looking in the wrong place. The story of all the Crysis games combined serves only one purpose, and that purpose is to give you a reason for going from A to B if wanderlust alone isn't going to cut it.Now then, how is the gameplay?The gameplay is great. It's everything you expect in a modern shooter - Decent-to-good AI, a nice selection of satisfying weaponry, explosives and gadgets. The Nano-Suit turns out to be one of the most interesting features in any FPS since the Gravity Gun, and the game is ripe for multiple playthroughs thanks to all of your options and the, at times, huge maps that you can get lost in. Crysis is perhaps the flagship of what a liniear open-world game can be - No, you're never really 'free' but you don't feel like you're being pushed through a bottleneck - because you're not! What Crysis likes to do is to give you a fairly simply objective, a huge map, and then basically leave it up to you as to how you go about completing your mission. You can go in guns blazing, blowing up enemies left, right and center, or you can play it like you would any stealth game, capitalizing on your ability to turn invisible. Graphically there's not really much to say. You can pick up and play this game today, and you won't be disappointed. Even by our current standards, this game arguably looks better than a lot of new releases. The low pricetag also means that it's going to outclass a lot of otherwise very competent indi-shooters. Definitely an all-time classic for me, and in my opinion the best game in the series.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
8, 2016
												08-Aug-2016 :  Finished main storyEquipment : MSI GT80-2QE NotebookREVIEW :I never had a chance to play this game back in 2007 because I didn't have the hardware strong enough to run it. Now that I have, boy, the graphics quality still doesn't show it's age. Technically, I didn't have any problem running this with newer hardware in Windows 10 environment, but I have problems with the gameplay aspects. First, the difficulty. I play this on Normal setting but I felt like playing on Hard. The nano-suit energy battery drained really quick. The ammo is scarce. The enemies are everywhere. The stealth and tactical approach are broken. I tried going Predator when infiltrating an enemy base and the cloaking device auto-disabled before I even had a chance to do any stealth kill because the battery already drained. The sniper rifle doesn't have suppresor and really hard to aim enemy from far away, so tactical approach by cloaking and sniping almost always ended with direct combat. Second, although the game is a sandbox, you really don't have any reason to exploring the island. Third, some of the level are frustrating because the game doesn't give  clear explanation on what to do. The final mission for example, you have to survive swarm of enemies and kill the boss using a special gun, but no explanation given on how to use it (you can't just shoot it). So between shooting the swarm of enemies, salvaging ammo, dodging deadly flames and attacks, you have to figure out yourself how to use this new special gun and keep dying in the process. Really annoying.The story is mediocre, little bit boring for my taste. The multiplayer doesn't work anymore because the servers were closed in 2014. Overall, a really good and innovative game back in 2007, but for today, I suggest save your time and play newer games instead.CONCLUSION :Recommended on sale price.

ber 18, 2016
												My problem with Crysis was that for a really long time I wanted to play this game but I didn't have a PC capable of handling it. Finally, when I got one back in the day, I fired the game up and after an hour I was like… meh. Is that all? I kept thinking.This had probably much to do with the fact that I was so much of a 'Call of Duty kid' that anything even remotely less resembling a railway, heavily scripted, cinematic shooter seemed like something worse to me. That's just the way I've been shaped by starting my journey with Modern Warfare franchise.However, after several years I came to appreciate the 'sandbox' experience in Crysis and I think it's actually really good. Especially given the fact that most of us now have the PCs able to run it on high settings and the game is quite cheap as well. If you haven't played it and you're a fan of shooters, you definitely should. 8/10

No wonder why people are ♥♥♥♥♥♥ at the crisis franchise after Crysis 2 and 3 when this is way better in the gameplay department. All in all both played is the perfect first person shooter package and will make you resent other first person shooters for not having the flexibility and fun of the Crysis franchise. In depth:Performance - Well the game is old. 7 years old at the time of this review. Other games in comparison that are 7 years old look like ♥♥♥♥. The game runs decent but runs better on windows xp due to Crytek not updating the game for windows 7. Will cause some frame drops and bad pop in regardless of your specs. So graphically the game holds up but performance will be random but playable and enjoyable.Graphics - So I said the game was smooth that must mean the game must look average right? Nope. Even now the game looks beautiful considering its 7 years old. The game in fact looks better than some games that came out this year. That shows that they actually value PC gaming and did not cash in with consoles the same way they did later on with crysis titles *cough* Crysis 2 and 3 *cough*. Gameplay - Now on to the gameplay: Solid. The gunplay is enjoyable and lots of different attachments which provides different choices against each enemy type. Each enemy is varied: From humans having a similar arsenal to you, flying squid aliens which ambush you and vehicles such as helis, jeeps and apcs that will need strategy to beat rather than a bigger gun, though that helps. Might I add that you can also drive them. You can see why I like this game? On top of that the nano suit brings you a new strategy to complete your objective. Armour making you a tank to go guns blazing, Stealth to be a cloak and dagger, dash to completely evade any enemy and strength to just throw ♥♥♥♥ at people. The game is so varied in how you approach objectives and how you complete them because of the open world map and the nano suit. Great in terms of depth and playstyles. Only drawback is the story which is very B-movie. It keeps the game going and gives you an excuse to enter new environments. The story is very generic; aliens evade, take them out, done. Its forgettable and basic so don’t buy it for that it’s the gameplay and graphics this rocks at.Replayability - A lot. With the playstyle, different weapons, attachments, routes, vehicles and pace can give totally new experiences. Not more to say then the time it took me I enjoyed every bit due to its flexibity and freedom lacking in game today. Conclusion - If you can’t tell I ♥♥♥♥ing love this game. Everything besides story just shows the potential and the missed chance many games coming out miss. Its not about building a story then putting in gameplay. Gameplay is what makes this game because it only focuses on that and as a result it’s amazing and competes with many games out now. Any playstyle is rewarded with the nano suit, weapons, attachments and vehicles. You probably have got it but if you don’t, GET IT.  MUST BUY!If you liked this review or want to see more recommended games, be sure to follow my curator group: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/FALLENV3GAS#curation

content:
er 20, 2014
												I wish I could give this game two reviews... You know what? I will The first two thirds are brilliant. Like Crytek's original "Far Cry," it's not the most polished game in existence but the degree of choice you are offered in each mission makes the game a blast either way. You can move as slowly and as stealthily as you like in Crysis... Or, if you think it's necessary, just blast everyone in your way. It leads to some varied gameplay, and you feel like you truly earn your victories. Score: AThen that final third... Ugh. They completely abandoned everything that made the game good and deflated an already uninspired plot in the process. Do yourself a favour and pretend it ends just before the aliens come into play.I wish Crytek would have more faith in their core gameplay rather than these gimmicks, because THAT is what stands out here. Not aliens. I honestly wish I didn't finish this game. Score: C-Overall score: B+Recommended for shooter and stealth fans focusing primarily on gameplay.

, 2014
												Don't buy this or the bundle with it.  I got Crysis 1 in the bundled pack and, after the Steam download I double click and the first run  tries to install Punkbuster and GameSpy, however neither of these is for the single player version of Crysis (in fact Crysis is no longer on Punkbuster servers so I didn't install that and Crytek is ceasing service on Crysis 1 and 2 shortly).  So sure I only paid 4 bucks more than if I had just bought Crysis 2 alone, but, obviously, I had hoped to play Crysis, then Crysis 2 to experience these in order myself, only to find this first version doesn't work, and I am not alone, http://steamcommunity.com/app/17300/discussions/0/45350245755182479/?tscn=1404766612.Save the 4 bucks for something else.  I have my fingers crossed Crysis 2 will work.  I am figuring Steam got a bad package or Crytek pulled a fast one on them.  As a single player gamer for a long time, game should install for the single player first, then these other multi-player options are available when you go to play multi-player.  I actually installed GameSpy, tried to play, then uninstalled it, and tried to play, no difference.  Again, save the 4 bucks for something else.

content:
er 25, 2013
												Crysis. From the company that had intrigued me for the longest time with their super realistic physics and graphics engine. I didn’t expect much from this game since the trailers made it look pretty much just like a tech demo. Surprisingly, though, it turned out to be a blast! Or at least half of it. There’s this supernatural atmosphere breathing down the neck of the player throughout the first act and it finally resolves itself as an alien invasion plot. Sadly, killing those aliens is just boring as hell. I would still classify this game as “good” because the first half of it is just so much fun. I must’ve spent hours just sneaking around the enemy bases and then tactically taking out the enemy soldiers from the shadows and that’s what made me wanna go on further and further. The graphics and physics are amazing and some of the driving and flying sections are a fun change of pace. It’s just that if we got a game that was like the first act of this game all the way through, it would easily deserve a couple of ranks higher score in my opinion.

ry 7, 2015
												Ugh, this game is...annoying.It still looks gorgeous. It has that going for it. The FPS is nice enough.But the technical issues..first, it'll probably not even start to work on Win7. There's patches, but they hardly work. The Steam version doesn't even include the 64-bit version.If you do get it running, it'l still probably crash and exit every so often. And now it's freezing my entire PC and causing a restart. I figured this was my PC - GPU stress test benchmarks cause absolutely no issues. It's just Crysis, every so often. After 10 scary sounding full PC crashes (and 30+ crash to desktop before), I gave up and looked up the ending online. It's boring.If you're sure your hardware can handle it, it's fine. It's beautiful, the gameplay is challenging and mostly pretty good..but there's a bunch of 'eh' moments which really ruined it. A lot of the same, mixed with a broken game.

content:
20, 2016
												Ahhh Crysis.This was one of those games which totally got me back into PC gaming.Yeah, some years I was actually quite frequently using a console but when this game came out...DAMN. I loved it. I actually build my first rig back then. Myself, no prebuild crap. 8600GT and a Intel Pentium 4. Back then I wasnt spending much money for hardware. With that specs I was able to play the game on medium settings with playable FPS but that was it pretty much. In 1024x768. Gosh, couldnt even imagine myself playing like this anymore. Back then no hardware could run it playable with 30FPS on Very High. I guess my rig had like 10FPS, haha.Also I was still using Windows XP so no DX10 for me back then, or 64Bit... Many years there was the term, "But can it run Crysis". Even today Crysis still serves as Benchmark. But thats snow from yesterday as we Germans say, so lets get into the review.The story is about some US soldiers invading a island named Ling Shan. Their mission is to safe some people and uncover the secrets of the island. You are Nomad and belong to those soldiers. The island belongs to the Korean army and General Kyong is the leader of them. The US soldiers dont stay undercover for long and have to deal with the army and... something else. Something else is present on this island and while you do your journey through the island you are going to uncover this entity.The game is a FPS. You have to pass through very big open world levels to reach your mission goals and progress in this game. While you are doing so, many soldiers and other things will attack you. Luckily you have a bunch of weapons AND the Nanosuit! The Nanosuit pretty much is the reason why this game sets itself apart from other generic FPS shooters. Its a armor with that you can be very strong, fast, armored and even invisible. For a certain time until the energy has to recover. I love this feature about the game. Its so simple, yet addicting. On your way you also often get the possibility of using vehicles. How you do certain goals is up to you. Go in guns blazing or stealth. On higher difficulties you should definitely try to stealth. The difficulty can be quite high at points. Especially when playing on something higher than normal.The game is made by Crytek. One of my favorite developers of our time.The game runs on the CryEngine 2 which, similar to Far Cry in 2004, made a revolution in terms of graphics in videogames. Nothing could even mess with the CryEngine 2 back then. Not even the Unreal Engine 3 which came out around the same time and often was praised for its graphics. It even offered DX10 and 64Bit support. But the downside of this was that the engine was extremely taxing on PCs. Even top notch highend rigs couldnt handle the game on very high settings. I really loved the graphics, it was amazing to see what actually was possible. It really looked like RL.Even today the game still looks stunning and beautiful, even if the CryEngine 3 probably took its place as best looking engine. This was especially noticeable after Crysis 3 came out. Crysis 2 sadly didnt use its full potencial at launch. But this was addressed with patches and even Crysis 2 looked stunning after the patches. Still, Crysis is unmatched for me in terms of gameplay and graphics. Also Crysis was not made for consoles, unlike its other games. Therefore I guess Crysis was not limited to anything like level sizes. But its probably also the memories that I have with this game. Crysis 2 and 3 are also amazing games and I like to replay all of them from time to time, or after I have a new rig. Always when I have a new rig or something about my hardware changed, its time to play Crysis. Its something like a ritual for me, haha.Postive:- MAXIMUM GRAPHICS- Somewhat good KI- Good difficulty- Interesting story which is told and explained in all 3 games- Nice weapon amount and feeling- High quality Crytek game- CHICKEN- Weapons are modable like attaching flashlight, laser, silencer, scopes- Game includes well performing cars- Nanosuit sets the game apart from other FPS- Amazing big open world levels- Great Soundtrack- 100% Pure PC game- Has a addon called Crysis Warhead- Even today still serves as Benchmark- Multiplayer still active with community patch- Many mods available- MEMORIESNegative:- Partly unoptimized for modern hardware, especially AMD, doesnt even run out of box on several rigs- Steam version missing 64Bit files, check my guide to obtain them- Some stupid small bugs like dying from collision...Replayability: Very HighMy Rating: 9.5/10This game is simply one of my favorites of all time. This probably has also to do with the memories I have with this game. I always have this moment in mind where I was walking through the bushes and reaching an overlook. The sun was just rising and I could see big part of the island with palm trees moving in the wind, sun breaking its light through the leaves and an amazing soundtrack fading in. Woah... One of the best moments in gaming ever.I also find it extremely well replayable. The gameplay is just extreme fun. The story is also well made.Definitely a game to pick up!

content:
ber 17, 2016
												Me 8 or 9 years ago was shed tears because i could play this game on the lowest of lowest quality on my laptop with a geforce 9200m GS. I was happy..... happy i could play this game..... even though i had to sacrfice a lot. When i say a lot, i mean put the game in the lowest of lowest quality...... play in window mode with the game soo small i had to put a black background as a wallpaper. and also manually tweek my graphic chip setting to get hte most performance.........I (Was)......happy.....even thgough most of the time it was 15fps.Today in 2016 using my 1 years old MSI laptop with a GTX960M.......i.....only could cry.....Not because it couldnt run it. No!!!!! it run it!!!! SOOOooooo well on max quality.... what else would any of you who suffered back in 2007 would do in my position?! The memories of hell, my laptop who was running at a temparature of 100, my patience, agony. the times i would cry when something so crazy would happen and bring my frames to 1fps or even crash the game or give me blue screen because of over heating or system emergency shut down.......TELL ME WHAT WOULD YOU DO???!!!!!!I could only cry....and laugh and cry more.You know what ..... this just came to me. because it took me 8 years to realise this. The studio who made this game were true geniuses and yet ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s. I mean..... not only did they name their game Cry_Sis but they even called themself Cry-tek. And during that time if you didnt own a computer that cost over 3K  all you could do is literally cry.I Shed more tears that night, for Crying was fitting for this game.....

												I bought this game when I got a new computer as this game was the game to play if you wanted to test the capabilities of your PC. The environment in this game is incredibly impressive. So good in fact that it was a good few hours before I noticed how boring the actual game was.  One of the trailers for the game shows you switching between your suit's different modes for a varied and exciting combat experience but this is completely unrepresentative of the game. Switching between the suit modes is very awkward and the different modes really aren't that good so I spent almost all the game in the standard mode. Don't think you are going to get some variety by using the vehicles as the only thing they are good for is exploding. I view this as benchmarking software rather than a game.

content:
4, 2011
												Crysis got a bad wrap because of the insane gaming rig necessary to play, but if you had a computer that could run it, Crysis was one of the best in the genre. The visuals were, obviously, stellar, but it was much more than that. Over time, the gameplay became… customizable. You could stealth in the middle of a group of enemies, grab one by the throat, throw him, drop a trip-mine, and run away before they even knew you were there. You were Batman mixed with the Predator mixed with The Flash, and it was freaking incredible. The expansion, Crysis: Warhead, turned down the plot and turned up the over-the-top gameplay, so, you know, it was also awesome.

content:
0, 2015
												After years of waiting to give this title a try, the opportunity finally presented itself and I carved out some time to really get into it.  Unfortunately, although it is a decent and mildly enjoyable game, I can't personally recommend Crysis.What I had thought would be a unique experience turned out to be a run-of-the-mill, fairly generic First-Person Shooter that failed to draw me in.  The suit mechanics are the game's strong point, as they are entertaining to use, but the rest of the game is quite lackluster in comparison.  As I played, it seemed to me that what got this game its hype was, by and large, the advanced graphical features of its day.  On this end, I will say that the game still holds up even eight years later.  The game looked good and the animations were smooth.As I stated previously, this is not a bad game, just one that no longer stands out for anything in particular.  If you're a huge fan of First-Person Shooters and need another to hold you over to the next release, I'd say go ahead and get it.  If you're looking for a new experience that's going to keep you enthralled for the length of the game, I would look elsewhere.

content:
r 29, 2015
												I have never been so angered by a video game.Crysis is a beautiful game. That's no secret. Beyond that, the shooting is competent and the nano suit adds a nice flavor to the game. It would be a pretty fun game if not for its glaring flaws. So let's dive into those.The game is poorly optimized. It looks great, but similarly good looking games run better. I'm using a 4770k @ 4.6 GHz and an overclocked GTX 970. It runs very well on max with 4x AA in most situations, but it occasionally lags, especially against aliens with their numerous projectile effects.Crysis can't seem to pick a difficulty and stick with it. You'll go fifteen minutes of easy gameplay, and suddenly it's impossibly difficult. The autosaves are few and far between, so you'll need to stay on top of that yourself. Assuming you don't die in a particularly difficult situation, you might die to any of the numerous bugs.That's right. The game is HORRIBLY buggy. Here is a nice list of terrible deaths and game-breaking bugs I encountered on a single playthrough:- Bumped into an object that is subject to phsysics. It collided funny and I was instantly killed by it, from full health, with 100% on armor.- Randomly fell over dead on numerous occasions, no enemies nearby, full health, no mines.- Vehicle bumps something at an odd angle, explodes.- Clipped through a floor and into a fire.- The second-to-last mission finished and crashed the game. Again. And again. I had to use a command console code to advance to the final mission.- The final mission allows you to progress beyond something that is necessary to finish it, causing you to have to restart the mission.The list could go on. I'm sure there are plenty I even forgot.Beyond the bugs, the game itself is just frustrating. The ground shooting segments are usually good, but the vehicle segments are some of the worst I've ever played. The VTOL is unresponsive and clunky, made even worse by tornados that just throw you to the ground. The tank mission is entirely too difficult at times. There is an escort mission where your friendly has to keep warm, and he twice failed to keep up with me and stand near a fire, getting himself killed. There is a lot of good in this game, but there are a lot of things so poorly executed, it clearly overshadows the good. Unless you're a masochist, do not buy this game.

												I'm going to have to go against the grain on this one, disagree with the average folk, and say this game is kinda ♥♥♥♥. It's graphics are amazing, and the destructible terrain is great. Gameplay, at least as far as how it handles, it good. But here's where the budget ran out. The NPC's are broken. They'll get stuck on walls, and at times will just walk one by one into a building for headshots like sheep, but they have very peculiar cones of vision at times and incredibly sharp eyes if you happen to be in that cone. Brush and rocks sometimes help keep you hidden, but overall the vegetation feels like it's more for looks than cover.And don't get me started on helicopters. If the AI doesn't decide the helicopter should leave on a whim, you can't run away. Find a missile launcher or get really good at using your grenade launcher, because there's no such thing as hiding from one. You could speed away and hide beneath a cliff wall, and the helicopter will magically, on a whim fly directly over you to see if you're over there, regardless of distance. Helicopters are fight or die and do not take damage from small arms fire or machine guns.The mechanics of the game are "cool" but quickly become a handicap when you realize just how many NPC's with pinpoint accuracy you're up against. Managing your energy becomes a chore, as your energy reserves are just too ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ low.You know what? Screw EVERYTHING I just said. You want to know why this game really fails? Because I don't really feel like a super soldier. Sure I have cool abilities and can take a few hits, but most FPS games are like that when you get down to it. This game fails on the simple notion that it doesn't make you feel like a super soldier. It's just meant to be visually pleasing as hell and have entertaining enough gameplay to keep the graphics obsessed players happy while the rest shrug and move on.

er 15, 2015
												When I built my very first gaming PC, this was the first game I bought. I suppose I was fairly sold on the novelty of owning "the benchmark game" at the time. However, I never really played it. Only a few weak attempts every now and again, but I never made any real progress.That said, I finally took the time to play through the game. I was kind of on the fence as to whether or not I'd recommend the title. I don't think so, not anymore. It's a beautiful game, but it's poorly optimized in most cases. The graphical fidelity is the only thing of note about this game, I think. The rest of it is nothing to write home about. The characters are shallow and cliche. The plot leaves much to be desired. The game is short, and can probably be beaten in around 6-7 hours if you know what you're doing. Maybe even quicker. The last level is UNBELIEVABLY glitchy. There are SO many glitches in that last level that can prevent you from beating the game entirely.  Back in the day this game would arguably be incredibly popular simply due to the graphics, but unfortunately the graphics are the only thing that's held up since its release.

content:
1, 2015
												Pros+Great graphics+Love the gun customization+alien enemy is pretty cool. Cons-Aiming, even with a controller is godawful-Driving, especially the tank level, is horrific-Were some parts where objectives are too vague for my personal taste.-A.I is a sniping ninja and will pull of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t kills from too far away making the game extremely annoying.-randomly dying because of random Michael Bay explosions for no reason-Ending is complete B.S., even though I know there are 2 sequels, the ending just feels like sequel bait for no reason. -Main character is completely boring, no character development at all, even for an FPS, this is intolerable. -Barely fun at times and when it does get fun, the fun parts are whisked away for less fun parts-SPOILER ALERT: THE ALIENS ARE BARELY IN THE F****** GAME!!!!Okay, so after completing the game, I know can give my full review on it, it's awful. And that's what pisses me off, because they got a lot of things right, but for everything they got right, they get 14 other things wrong.  First of all aiming is atrocious and I play with a controller, second driving is godawful and I hate the part where they FORCE YOU TO DRIVE A TANK WHILE THE A.I SNIPES YOU WITH F****** ROCKET LAUNCHERS!  Also the characters are so bland I probably won't remember their names after writing this review. The story is decent at times but there are huge plot holes in that too which I will list at the end. Also the difficulty is ridiculous, especially the final boss, who is only difficult because of random a** Michael Bay level explosions that kill you in a second and have no warning whatsoever, also the alien freeze ray thing is B.S. I had to look online to figure out how to get unstuck, there was no button prompt for that.  The game's ending is also atrocious after dealing with two godawful, no fun, and above all lazy boss fights and by lazy I mean bosses that look cool but are so boring and not fun that you wouldn't want to ever fight them again, the ending doesn't feel like an ending. To be fair I am aware of Crysis 2 and 3 but honestly you can give us a better ending than just the main character saying "No we get back in the fight" drop ship door closes thee end. Also the final boss feels more like a middle boss because SPOILER ALERT: YOU SPEND NEARLY 2 -THIRDS OF THE GAME FIGHTING KOREANS IN A JUNGLE AND ABOUT THE LAST 3RD OF THE GAME FIGHTING THE ALIENS!!!If I wanted to fight Korean soldiers with an assault rifle I'd just play COD like everybody else (I hate COD by the way), I expected to be fighting aliens within the first 3-4 levels but wrong they don't come till the end. Granted the aliens are fun, the first few times you fight them, until you realize there are only 2 TYPES OF ALIENS IN THE ENTIRE GAME EXCLUDING 2 BOSSES!!!!And the only difference? One is big and flies above and rains needler-like blades on you from above and can take a lot of damage, the other? Smaller, shoots at you with smaller projectiles, and bum-rushes you for quick stabs. BORING.  Everything falls apart in the final act, the first level outside with the aliens is phenomenal it's one of the best levels I've played in a shooter in a while, I felt like I was in some Summer Blockbuster, and I was excited to see where the rest of the game was going (I expected a solid 3 -4 hours of alien fighting) and then the aircraft carrier level takes a steaming turd on it. SPOILER'S AHEAD PLOT GRIPES:-The fact that your team leader Prophet learns how to hot-wire an alien gun to use against the aliens is never addressed.-Generic evil Korean villain for half the game serves no purpose but to be filler for when aliens show up and is also sent off in a weak boss fight. -Your character has the personality of a turnip, hell nearly everyone does. -U.S decides to use nukes to solve everything cliche, (called it about a full hour before it happens)-Aliens don't show up till like the last 2-3 levels instead of midway through the game like one would think.-Main character walks into nuclear powered aircraft carrier reactor core and lowers the rods and does not suffer from radiation poisoning or any sort of side effects because nanosuit. -Your boss leaves the aircraft carrier because he knows the nuke will fail and heads back to the island to fight instead of helping stop them from destroying your entire fleet. -Ending is not an ending, it's like they cut a much larger game in half. SPOILER'S END HERE:Final Verdict?: A strong 5.5/10  OVERRATED AS F***!!!!!

content:
ber 8, 2015
												Yes, this game has amazing graphics (just getting it out of the way). The combat is smooth and very complex, thanks to the ubiquitous nano-suit, which can help you run at superhuman speeds, punch through walls (or kill enemies with one blow from a toilet brush), or turn invisible for a short period of time. The settings vary considerably, from the almost-tropical beaches to the icy mountains of the Lingshan Islands. Weapon selection was good, and only improved when the Aliens were unleashed (Molecular Accelerator or Gauss Rifle, anyone?). It should also be pointed out that the plot shift from focus on North Korea to the Alien threat was a pleasant surprise, as it changed things up before they became too boring. The story was not that great, and the characters rather pathetic in their own right (save for Psycho), but hey! When the action is this good, who's complaining? Great weapons customization options (each weapon can be tailored to the individual players' needs). The vehicular combat was not spectacular, but another game made by Crytek down the line will address that...9/10

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
er 29, 2015
												I really liked this game. At first.But slowly it dawned on me why this game is a steaming pile of over rated ♥♥♥♥. I will outline why this is, but first I would like to talk about the parts I really enjoyed and wished there was more of.In the early game, you are presented with a fiarly open world to accoplishe your objectives in. Or at least, it seemed open. You are free to approch your objectives as you see fit. Stealth in with scilenced guns and keep the gaurds from alerting more troops? Yes. Come at the base from that cliff or out of those trees, or even by underwater sneak attack? Indeed you may.There is plenty of ammo and a representation of each basic type of FPS gun. Pistol, Shotugn, two types of rifle, ordiance, long rifle. There is even a minigun and some c4 bricks to play with. Grenades and spare magazines are aplenty in this fast paced shooter with a few adventure elements. So be not afraid to waste rounds, or get right into the KPA's face. You're a super soldiger. Did I mention you can blow the crap out of tanks, jeeps, boats, helicopters, and artileray? You can do that too. And it is some rewarding stuff.As for the not so good.There are two female characters. The ONLY reason this is relevant is how poorly designed they are, rather than some "progressive" retorich about "diversity in X." The reason this left an impression that I dispise, is that not only did their animations suck but their design was... stupid. The devs WENT THROUGH THE TROUBLE to animate boob jiggle for the 2 female characters in the stroy. This would be excusable but it is not for reasons I'll address during the critique of the physics engine. These women were also in some weird mid-drif sweater getup... Which is terrible design. They can be sexy, but it needs to make sense for a TROPICAL ISLAND SETTING. Hai I'm in a sweater, but my navel is too hot. Also here is som jiggle to go with my ♥♥♥♥. It's irritating that time was spent on such an insignifigant phystics detail on the rig, that it makes me sad to look at the overall physics for the game.For the steaming plate of crap that is the entree of this game.Oh the physics. I love that I can toss a nade' or shoot a ♥♥♥♥ing rocket at a building... AND IT WILL FALL DOWN ON THE FOOLS INSIDE. That is some satisfying ♥♥♥♥. There is even funny stuff, such as a dead man's shotgun clipping through the wall for about 20 minutes. A gilitch, sure. But it was funny. What is not funny is the overally bugginess of the game is it's overall downfall. I have played many games. And video games have taught me how to play them.Consider for a moment, when I first jumped into a recently aquired jeep. It drove much like one would expect; like a drunk stupid truck with poor handeling. What one would expect. I really wish this game didn't try to be things it wasn't. I liked the early game, I liked the freedom and agency... But then came the Tank level. I was excited for it.I was ready to drive me A TANK.I was ready to blow my foes the crap to hell.I have played World of Tanks. I have a semblance of how tanks should drive, fire, deflect hits, ect... I did not really have high expectations for the tanks, I assumed it'd be much like halo 2. Be careful and you'll do fine, and things will die with modest effort. 3 hours later I finally made progress on that level. These "tanks" are incredibly frail. They drive like bricks, not like tanks. And due to the WONDERFUL physics engine. You can take about 12% damage for trying to run over infantry. :D IN A TANK. A THIRTY TON WAR CHARIOT. And in this video game, you get an unlimited ammount of turret ammunition. No such luxuray is afforded to your main cannon. The big boom stick. 30 rounds. For the whole level. And tanks take 3 or more rounds to kill. But I digress.I have place Ace Combat. Most likely the best military based video game I have ever played. And undoubatably the best flight sim ever. After the tank debacle, my hopes were not high. Not that I expected this to be Ace Combat. But when it put me at the seat of a plane. I SMASHED INTO THE GROUND AND DIED WITHIN 15 seconds. No inverted controls in a plane.... Because game design. Okay. So the next 14 retries, was me slowly smashing into the ground, smashing into mountians, getting scotted around on the ground by tornados... But then, they told me to dogfight some aliens.... I was in tears. 30 more deaths and I WON THE ♥♥♥♥ING DOGFIGHT. Only for the game to crash for mabey the tird time in my total gametime. As if a massive ♥♥♥♥ you to me as a person. Such rage filled me. Upon relaunching the game, the physics did seem to improve.... and there was no dogfight... Just me shooting at the mostly grounded aliens.... Okay...?This is when my gaming experience went from a few events of bugs/crashes/glitchy sorcery. To MAXIXMUM OVERDRIVE. I find it hard to believe that this [at the time] beloved game was so riddled with glaring issues. I'm suspecting that this game isn't really that demanding of CPU's and GPU's. Rather it is the foolish and misinformed public implying it is to benchmark their PC's. It seems this game is coded poorly and runs poorly. The fps seems fine... It's just... a badly made game.Speaking of badly made. This also features EVERYONE'S favorite video game trope. THE GOD DAMNED WATER LEVEL. Yes, there is essentially a water level in this game, had I known this beforehand. I would have saved my money and my time... At about this time the story and pace of the game becomes faster paced and more linear. Which I don't mind so much as the bugs... I did really hate the water level. Especially that you were expected to fight some trash mobs in said zero-gravity environment.I crashed to desktop a total of 3 times during the last 2 or 3 "chapters" of the game. I beat it.... Except for the part where I beat it. When encountering the final boss, I fell through the deck twice. Got merked countless times. Got one shot-ed by the boss 6 times. Got one shot-ed by trash mobs at least twice as many times. And when I open it's weak spot. And Joker and ♥♥♥♥♥face [one more complaint in a moment,] keep telling me to NUKE THE ♥♥♥♥ING THING. The gun refuses to lock on thus completing the boss fight. I'm not replaying the final level. What a great way to put this whole game in a nut shell. content:
ber 8, 2015
												Yes, this game has amazing graphics (just getting it out of the way). The combat is smooth and very complex, thanks to the ubiquitous nano-suit, which can help you run at superhuman speeds, punch through walls (or kill enemies with one blow from a toilet brush), or turn invisible for a short period of time. The settings vary considerably, from the almost-tropical beaches to the icy mountains of the Lingshan Islands. Weapon selection was good, and only improved when the Aliens were unleashed (Molecular Accelerator or Gauss Rifle, anyone?). It should also be pointed out that the plot shift from focus on North Korea to the Alien threat was a pleasant surprise, as it changed things up before they became too boring. The story was not that great, and the characters rather pathetic in their own right (save for Psycho), but hey! When the action is this good, who's complaining? Great weapons customization options (each weapon can be tailored to the individual players' needs). The vehicular combat was not spectacular, but another game made by Crytek down the line will address that...9/10

content:
er 29, 2015
												I really liked this game. At first.But slowly it dawned on me why this game is a steaming pile of over rated ♥♥♥♥. I will outline why this is, but first I would like to talk about the parts I really enjoyed and wished there was more of.In the early game, you are presented with a fiarly open world to accoplishe your objectives in. Or at least, it seemed open. You are free to approch your objectives as you see fit. Stealth in with scilenced guns and keep the gaurds from alerting more troops? Yes. Come at the base from that cliff or out of those trees, or even by underwater sneak attack? Indeed you may.There is plenty of ammo and a representation of each basic type of FPS gun. Pistol, Shotugn, two types of rifle, ordiance, long rifle. There is even a minigun and some c4 bricks to play with. Grenades and spare magazines are aplenty in this fast paced shooter with a few adventure elements. So be not afraid to waste rounds, or get right into the KPA's face. You're a super soldiger. Did I mention you can blow the crap out of tanks, jeeps, boats, helicopters, and artileray? You can do that too. And it is some rewarding stuff.As for the not so good.There are two female characters. The ONLY reason this is relevant is how poorly designed they are, rather than some "progressive" retorich about "diversity in X." The reason this left an impression that I dispise, is that not only did their animations suck but their design was... stupid. The devs WENT THROUGH THE TROUBLE to animate boob jiggle for the 2 female characters in the stroy. This would be excusable but it is not for reasons I'll address during the critique of the physics engine. These women were also in some weird mid-drif sweater getup... Which is terrible design. They can be sexy, but it needs to make sense for a TROPICAL ISLAND SETTING. Hai I'm in a sweater, but my navel is too hot. Also here is som jiggle to go with my ♥♥♥♥. It's irritating that time was spent on such an insignifigant phystics detail on the rig, that it makes me sad to look at the overall physics for the game.For the steaming plate of crap that is the entree of this game.Oh the physics. I love that I can toss a nade' or shoot a ♥♥♥♥ing rocket at a building... AND IT WILL FALL DOWN ON THE FOOLS INSIDE. That is some satisfying ♥♥♥♥. There is even funny stuff, such as a dead man's shotgun clipping through the wall for about 20 minutes. A gilitch, sure. But it was funny. What is not funny is the overally bugginess of the game is it's overall downfall. I have played many games. And video games have taught me how to play them.Consider for a moment, when I first jumped into a recently aquired jeep. It drove much like one would expect; like a drunk stupid truck with poor handeling. What one would expect. I really wish this game didn't try to be things it wasn't. I liked the early game, I liked the freedom and agency... But then came the Tank level. I was excited for it.I was ready to drive me A TANK.I was ready to blow my foes the crap to hell.I have played World of Tanks. I have a semblance of how tanks should drive, fire, deflect hits, ect... I did not really have high expectations for the tanks, I assumed it'd be much like halo 2. Be careful and you'll do fine, and things will die with modest effort. 3 hours later I finally made progress on that level. These "tanks" are incredibly frail. They drive like bricks, not like tanks. And due to the WONDERFUL physics engine. You can take about 12% damage for trying to run over infantry. :D IN A TANK. A THIRTY TON WAR CHARIOT. And in this video game, you get an unlimited ammount of turret ammunition. No such luxuray is afforded to your main cannon. The big boom stick. 30 rounds. For the whole level. And tanks take 3 or more rounds to kill. But I digress.I have place Ace Combat. Most likely the best military based video game I have ever played. And undoubatably the best flight sim ever. After the tank debacle, my hopes were not high. Not that I expected this to be Ace Combat. But when it put me at the seat of a plane. I SMASHED INTO THE GROUND AND DIED WITHIN 15 seconds. No inverted controls in a plane.... Because game design. Okay. So the next 14 retries, was me slowly smashing into the ground, smashing into mountians, getting scotted around on the ground by tornados... But then, they told me to dogfight some aliens.... I was in tears. 30 more deaths and I WON THE ♥♥♥♥ING DOGFIGHT. Only for the game to crash for mabey the tird time in my total gametime. As if a massive ♥♥♥♥ you to me as a person. Such rage filled me. Upon relaunching the game, the physics did seem to improve.... and there was no dogfight... Just me shooting at the mostly grounded aliens.... Okay...?This is when my gaming experience went from a few events of bugs/crashes/glitchy sorcery. To MAXIXMUM OVERDRIVE. I find it hard to believe that this [at the time] beloved game was so riddled with glaring issues. I'm suspecting that this game isn't really that demanding of CPU's and GPU's. Rather it is the foolish and misinformed public implying it is to benchmark their PC's. It seems this game is coded poorly and runs poorly. The fps seems fine... It's just... a badly made game.Speaking of badly made. This also features EVERYONE'S favorite video game trope. THE GOD DAMNED WATER LEVEL. Yes, there is essentially a water level in this game, had I known this beforehand. I would have saved my money and my time... At about this time the story and pace of the game becomes faster paced and more linear. Which I don't mind so much as the bugs... I did really hate the water level. Especially that you were expected to fight some trash mobs in said zero-gravity environment.I crashed to desktop a total of 3 times during the last 2 or 3 "chapters" of the game. I beat it.... Except for the part where I beat it. When encountering the final boss, I fell through the deck twice. Got merked countless times. Got one shot-ed by the boss 6 times. Got one shot-ed by trash mobs at least twice as many times. And when I open it's weak spot. And Joker and ♥♥♥♥♥face [one more complaint in a moment,] keep telling me to NUKE THE ♥♥♥♥ING THING. The gun refuses to lock on thus completing the boss fight. I'm not replaying the final level. What a great way to put this whole game in a nut shell. "It looks so cool, but it dosen't work."And ♥♥♥♥♥ Face. Bith Face was a scientist, and like all of them in this game had the one line of dialouge of; "We need more time, and we don't know what the hell this is!" Except ♥♥♥♥♥ Face had the additional dialouge options of "HELP ME I'M A WEAK WHINY WOMAN." And "I'm going to order this super soldiger around like I have some sort of autority." Again, the design of this game is poor, and the writing is b movie at best. But this strange dynamic that whatever her name is, really grated my nerves. Either be an autoratitive ♥♥♥. OR be a whiny immature coward. But don't alternate like a scitsophrinic patient.I really liked this game at the start. I wish it would have stayed realtivcily open. I wanted to give it a reccomendation, but given what I have seen. AND THE WAY THE BOSS GLITCHED OUT ON ME. I can not in good faith reccomend this to anybody. Especially when the devs care enough about their bottom line to include 3RD PARTY DRM, but they don't care enough to apply rudimentary patches. ♥♥♥♥ you crysis. This game was a crisis.

content:
15, 2016
												4/5A fun FPS with a twist. You play as a futuristic Super-soldier with the ability to turn invisible or turn your Armor on to resist bullets. This game is semi-open world and gives you the option for multiple ways to take down your enemies. The combat is fun and engaging, and definitely keeps you on your toes. You can only carry a handful of weapons at a time, you constantly need to monitor your suit's energy usage, and you never know when there's a hidden sniper waiting in a tree for you. The game allows you to roll with your own playstyle if you prefer to run in with Armor and a shotgun or stealth through the bushes with a long range rifle. The weapons are all responsive and unique, and customizable to suit yourself. I found myself struggling to decide which ones I wanted to keep with me. The environment is beautiful, the entire island is rich and looks like they put a lot of effort into it. The areas where you make enemy contact are designed for fun firefights with lots of movement and interaction with the environment--especially when some of it is destructible. However, the game is a bit repetitive and there are only like 2 boss fights, so a lot of your time is spent running around the island and dealing with more normal enemies, with a few breaks in the monotony. Also about 2/3 of the way through the game, the focus is shifted more towards fighting aliens instead of the human enemies, which changes the gameplay a little bit.Still, it was a fun adventure, a good FPS, and interesting story.

content:
er 16, 2016
But can it runCRYSIS?I find it hard to believe that the original Crysis is 9 years old now (as of writing this review). It hearkens me back to my days as a wee lad without a care in the world, playing classics such as Serious Sam and Condition Zero on a Pentium 4 machine. Back when a 500gb hard drive was the pinnacle of human computation and a dedicated video card seemed like a Crysis changed all of that.The release of Crysis was an earth-shattering event. Thousands of tortured souls cried out in terror and gnashing of teeth as their systems ran Crysis poorly, if it ran at all. At first, I didn't give a single hoot. But I saw the screenshots in magazines, saw the rants and cries of anguish on internet message boards. And I was mesmerised. All I wanted to be was "hardcore" PC gamer.And finally after 9 long years and many crappy, ill advised PC builds later, I had a real rig. A serious, "hardcore" PC Gamer rig. I was ready. Finally, I could take the girl of my dreams for a night out and fulfill all my pent up, sweaty, juvenile fantasies!It was ok, I guess. However obsessed you are with the myth and fantasy of something, 9 years is still a long, long time. A mind-blowing game 9 years ago is just pretty good. But hey, at least I can say I did it. I can run Crysis.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ARBITRARY NUMBER RATING : 5/7~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

content:
ry 1
Product received for free
												Years ago, this was the game used to test high-end gaming rigs - I always heard Crysis mentioned in the same breath as FPS rates, not gameplay.  Well having finally played it I can say that, with its days as a hyped-up benchmark tool behind it, Crysis is a decent shooter...but not a great one.  It feels console-ish, mostly linear and a little over-dramatic.  The best sequences are in the first half, fighting North Korean soldiers in a jungle environment that still wows.  Cloaking, sniping, grabbing enemies from behind - it's all great fun.  But suddenly you're whisked to the interior of an alien ship, and as other reviews have said, that's where the game loses its charm.  The alien levels, while unique, aren't as visually appealing as the jungle areas, and the gameplay becomes much more linear.  You eventually escape and, after some overwrought dialog, defend a doomed carrier via an irritating boss level.  My game crashed a couple times at the end due to corrupted savegames, but despite all that I still enjoyed most of the game.  Get it when it goes on sale.

content:
17, 2015
												To preface: I am not an avid fan of the FPS genre.  I can enjoy games when they are well made, but the mechanics of FPS games do not inherently have much appeal to me.Its really hard to say much about this game.  I'm sure it was an amazing title when it came out but it doesn't age well because the story is thin and not fleshed out.  As such it ends up as just another shooter, maybe a little less boring than the others.  Performance in this game suffers hard.  On my 6850 HD / 2.8ghz *6 / 12GB system on a mix of High/Med visuals the game NEVER got above 35FPS if any action or foliage was on screen.  In the end part of the game impossible slowdown would occur, causing frame dips into the single digits.  Even reducing resolution and graphics options did not remedy this, although some persistence and restarting the game several times helped make it through.  The game did not throw event triggers properly at least four or five times in my playthrough, requiring reloading of earlier saves.  Physics interactions were also problematic, making slowdown from colliding objects and leading to vehicles becoming inescapably stuck.  The graphics quality does seem alright, but since none of the environments have any artistic influence or design aside from the alien area its mostly wasted.Gameplay does not stray far from the formula, but that is to be expected of AAA games.  Its more or less the same formula as Far Cry down to the letter, with the addition of a stamina meter that also serves as regenerating shield and cloak.  Everything is the same.  Stealth isn't meaningful, the open environments are still actually linear, enemies spot you from a bit farther away than is reasonable (better than far cry at least) and have horrible pathing and AI.  Gun variety is par for the course and more or less feels fine.  Vehicles are still overpowered for their mounted guns, and enemies with mounted guns are still problematic.  Environments are all generic jungle up until the end of the game.  The characters are all stereotypes and completely lack depth.  The game's story is intentionally incomplete, doesn't cohere well, and cuts short at the end in a sequel hook so painful it almost feels insulting.  You have a few moments that don't really mesh.  Enemy nano-suit wearers ambush you once but never appear again.  You have to perform a pseudo escort mission for an ally presumed dead after escaping some aliens and then he just bails for the sequel hook.  The koreans just exist as convenient foreigners for you to shoot at until the aliens appear.  I don't think its strange to want story in an FPS or any other game, but its a different kind of appeal I guess between Deus Ex or Bioshock Infinite or Fallout NV and something more arcadey like this.  Far Cry 1 dragged on forever with its pacing over 15 hours and this game just suddenly ends with no resolution after 10 hours. There's... nothing special about this game.  Its just solid enough to not be terrible and looks alright.  You're better off spending your money elsewhere, certainly not worth the $20 being asked for today.  No reason to not wait for a sale if you're going to bother at all.

content:
27, 2015
												This is gonna be stream-of-consciousness because I'm too lazy to structure this right now.Crysis is bipolar. The game basically goes from awesome to ♥♥♥♥ after one loading screen between levels 7 and 8. The first 7 levels of Crysis are great pieces of FPS level design, taking the "wide corridor" approach, granting you significant tactical leeway in how you approach objectives and providing some great scenery to boot. Supersuit is fun to use, though a bit...clunky. The Crysis 2 suit is better because many of its actions are automatic and don't require switching suit modes; nevertheless, a fun addition. Level 3 is literally one of the best levels in any FPS ever in terms of the map, scripting, enemy variety and placement and environmental synergy. Human AI some of the best ever created.An there theres the last 4 levels of the game when the Alien machines show up......yeah. Look it doesn't matter that I spoiled it, the game itself spoils it in the description, you're fighting aliens with a supersuit, that's the game's whole premise. Course they don't show up until more than halfway through the game, there's barely any of them to actually fight, the frozen jungle gimmick is never actually implemented fully, the levels they appear in are too damn linear, the Alien AI is stupid, stealth is basically useless, so overall these levels simply don't provide an entirely enjoyable gameplay experience.Nevertheless, 7 good levels and 4 bad still warrants a recommendation - just wait until it's on sale or something for like 5 bucks. Cuz trust me, you do NOT get your money's worth with those last 4 levels.Graphics are good but you already know that.Story basically doesn't exist, but you already know that.Sound effects are really good, music is generic as all hell, voice acting is pure cheese.Crysis Warhead is better in every way than this.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
ry 1
Product received for free
												Years ago, this was the game used to test high-end gaming rigs - I always heard Crysis mentioned in the same breath as FPS rates, not gameplay.  Well having finally played it I can say that, with its days as a hyped-up benchmark tool behind it, Crysis is a decent shooter...but not a great one.  It feels console-ish, mostly linear and a little over-dramatic.  The best sequences are in the first half, fighting North Korean soldiers in a jungle environment that still wows.  Cloaking, sniping, grabbing enemies from behind - it's all great fun.  But suddenly you're whisked to the interior of an alien ship, and as other reviews have said, that's where the game loses its charm.  The alien levels, while unique, aren't as visually appealing as the jungle areas, and the gameplay becomes much more linear.  You eventually escape and, after some overwrought dialog, defend a doomed carrier via an irritating boss level.  My game crashed a couple times at the end due to corrupted savegames, but despite all that I still enjoyed most of the game.  Get it when it goes on sale.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
, 2016
												Crysis is this game.Crysis Warhead is a psuedo sequel, the same time frame played from your buddy's perspective.Crysis Wars is defunct multiplayer.Crysis 2 is the proper sequel but plays very differently than the above.Crysis 3 (and 4) are on "Origin" not Steam.Background:Crysis was the benchmark in PC graphics for a very long time.  It's 2016 and this game still looks fairly decent.  Probably the first game I've ever played where a forest feels like a real forest.  Way ahead of its time and most people's hardware.  Unfortunately it also missed out on a lot of optimization potential that later games got right.  Even with a GTX 970 with comparable SSD+processor this game loads slowly and did have issues in an aerial sequence.  I had settings almost maxed (keep that motion blur disabled thanks) except for the aerial bit.  The UI is terrible and every session I had to put fullscreen back on.Gameplay:This is an oldschool first person military shooter with sandbox elements and regular cut scenes.  You start off with all suit powers (hold middle click and drag in a direction):- default is armor which includes faster health regen- then cloak is overpowered (drains power as you move and drops if you attack) yet fails at melee range.- strength makes you jump higher and absorb more falling damage- speed makes you run faster, really fast for a short timeGood to know stuff:Falling damage can kill (use strength to minimize).  The suit lets you breath underwater.  There's also a separate night vision that drains a separate power meter.  Armored vehicles require explosives to destroy.  You can only carry three kinds of weapons at a time, but can swap on the fly and recall a previous weapon's ammo pool (which is the only reason to swap late game).  Health is regenerative but the meter is on screen.  In this iteration, ammo pickups are totally manual.  Crouch and fully prone are separate functions.  WHENEVER YOU GET IN A VEHICLE HIT F1 FOR THIRD PERSON!  No achievements or collectibles, just secondary objectives with no impact aside from providing another ammo cache.  Relatively short compared to today's titles (9-15 hours).Verdict:Crysis was a great game in its time.  It's an oldschool precursor to the Call of Duty franchise.  But if that's what you're hoping for, you won't enjoy this.  The game is fairly unforgiving (though stealth is an obvious option) and there are a few really annoying aspects.  Ammo, enemy, and suit power management are a must.  Play on easy if you are at all worried, you will still die a bunch.  It's polished but not streamlined; if you played any of the other games (which included many quality of play improvements) you might want to skip this one.Psuedo spoilers "what are you getting into":The game has several innovative sequences, but that could also be a source of frustration as the game starts off almost sandbox then gets fairly linear.  The game shifts in tone and even play style half way through, leading me to miss the earlier sections of assaulting Korean bases.  The ending absolutely has a nice final boss for a climax, but then acts like one of the next games will pick up your character's life a few minutes later.  They don't, making that sort of a cliffhanger.Bottom line:  Worth $4

content:
29, 2015
7/10: GoodSummary: A visually appealing fps with some interesting mechanics, an interesting setting, and a well made max difficulty system.Visual Appeal: Looks fantastic, even years later.Sound: You will have to adjust volume settings to hear some of the dialogue over music/vehicles/explosions. Reasonable gun-sound. Vegitation makes some sound when you move through it.Controls: Fully customizable.Game-Feel: Mostly good times, except when jumping in max strength mode.Difficulty: On Delta, the game is at its best. Hard enough to require restarts to checkpoints fairly often, but only because the AI is pretty damn smart. Nothing feels too unfair, for the most part.Story: Kinda throws you into it and cuts you out of it really fast, but all the meat in the middle is pretty interesting.Pace: Will probably take you about 12 hours to beat it on Delta difficulty. More if you take the scenic routes. Atmosphere: A combination of high quality visuals, good lighting, and reasonably decent sound design can lend to some great moments.Features: Multiplayer no longer supported through GameSpy, but there is multiplayer through Crysis Wars

number of helpful: 3 of 8 people (38%) found this review helpful
content:
r 1, 2016
												Total Score:  62/100  C+ (Maximum Mediocrity!)Graphics and Art:  9Sound and Music:  7Story and Plot:  2Controls:  8Creativity and Uniqueness:  2Mood and Immersion:  6Length, Content, and Replayability:  7Functionality:  9Character Choice and Customization:  5Challenge:  7Crysis is to games what, say, Transformers or Armagheddon are to movies.  It's clean, looks good, nice effects, high budget, and you won't remember it in a week or two.  There is, however, for a first-person shooter, a single kinda-neat thing.  There really are a variety of ways to work through the game.  You can sneak past all the enemies, kill all the enemies, use ambient vehicles (or not, for the most part), etc.  And, to be honest, I'm not entirely sure the "being able to sneak past all the enemies" thing is intended or not, but with something this, relatively speaking for FPSs, open ended, the developers had to know that all sorts of solutions would be possible.  I found the game to be almost entirely bug-free except for a single time I found the enemies to be unkillable, reloaded, and it was fixed.  The story, is, well, really, really bad:  predictable, cliche, uninteresting, and cringe-worthy (oh, so much cringe).  I didn't care about any of the protagonists or antagonists for that matter.  I kind of thought it would be a mercy for the aliens to destroy this mundane, boring version of Earth.  Also, the North Koreans are, once again, the completely unrealistic antagonists (the Korean translaton of what they are saying is, maybe, "Get that guy!  Maybe he has a sandwich!"), mostly because every other nation on Earth was involved in production and marketing, as you can see in the credits (the dubious reward for game completion).  It would be far better and less immersion-breaking to, just, make up an alternate world where this is happening or, say, create a new country in the future unrelated to real-world geo-politics, but that's just me.  But, then again, that requires creativity, and it's impossible to mass-produce creativity.  With such a bad story, what's another unrealistic, tropish plot point?  Man, I said a lot of bad things, but this is actually a fun game, despite the mediocrity.  It's fun to blow up tanks or use the various vehicles, or even to sneak around, which is mostly what I did.

content:
5, 2015
												Instead of Crysis, it should be called Crashes, because that's what it does. The game literally crashed or froze on me 6 times during installation and in the menus, before I even got to the game itself. If I make any changes in the menu at all, it immediately crashes. I mean, I changed the suit voice from male to female and the game crashed. Changed from windowed to full screen...crash. Changed resolution...crash. ANY change will cause the game to crash. Not only that, there's a checkpoint system, a relic from consoles, that causes the game to freeze for 5 seconds every time you hit one of those checkpoints. So far I've hit one of those checkpoints about once every 3 minutes. I, therefore, cannot recommend this broken game and I can't believe it's being sold for money. I can't ever see myself finishing this game with all these crashes and freezes. It just ruins the experience.

												It is sad to say that I cannot recommend the Steam version of the game as for some reason it does not run for me no matter what  I've tried to fix the game. If you really want to play the game I would highly recommend getting the original DVD of the game and install it from there. (that's what worked for me at least) As for Crysis itself, it is an absolutely beautiful game. The freedom of choice of approach to your objectives is unlike any other game even to this day. Unlike the Crysis 2 or 3 which just gives you 3 or 4 different approaches, it is completely up to you in the original Crysis. The beautiful graphics and the design of the jungle in the game that still challanges the hardware of today is like a cherry on top making it the best game of 2007 and one of the best games to this date.

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
, 2014
												To preface this, I am not fully finished with this game but  i have a good amount of hours into the story. I bought it on steam and due to some odd glitches i've had to fenagle my way into playing it. Onto my review. I've played crysis 2, and maybe that was bad before playing this first. I'm fairly into the game at the momentand feel that it's increasingly repetitive and overall a bit lacking. Stealth mechanics are bare to where you would think the Koreans all wore some sort of extra-sensory devices. Hiding behind anything, inside bushes...doesn't work. If you get seen, prepare to fight hands on for the ENTIRE chapter. Every enemy will know where you are and there's no way to reduce the aggro enough to go back to stealth mechanics. Perhaps I'm overdoing the stealth, or just suck, but that's my opinion on that.The story so far is not completely amazing, but it's building slowly but surely. I wish I cared more about the faceless nanosuit owners who fight with you (for the first minute or so of each chapter, then you're a lone wolf). As for running the game....it's not bad for me personally.  I have an 800$ pre-made laptop and can run it on "high" until the action kicks up. after the sixth or so enemy starts blasting you, the frame rate drops a bit. Not a bad game, buy it if you're bored and it's on sale. I did.  6/10

content:
y 3, 2014
												At its best, Crysis is an immersive free roam FPS with a few cool abilities that you can use in battle. At its worst , Crysis is a boring repetitive FPS with a bad story and nothing interesting to explore. Crysis has a mediocre unbalanced multiplayer, a campaign that's no fun, and an irritating AI. The graphics are good and the sound effects are awesome but those two things don't really make up for the arguably bad gameplay and the repetitive missions.

number of helpful: 2 of 7 people (29%) found this review helpful
content:
ber 20, 2016
 The best and worst of FPS gamingCrysis is a decent game, thats all I can say. It's graphics and gunplay are top notch and does live up to expectations. However theres just so many frustrating flaws. The plot is a mediocre 'OMG we discovered aliens and millitaries want to get involved'. The mission areas are placed too far apart, forcing you to traverse on foot for half an hour at times. Level designs sometimes feels too linear despite the huge open map. The variety of weapons attachments are fun and makes combat fluid, but again the big issue is that sometimes the results are unpredictable. Damage is always heavily affected by RNG, sometimes enemies can survive multiple shotgun blasts but can die from two or three rifle shots. So overall the game looks and plays well, theres just too many little frustrations here and there that makes crysis less impressive than, say Killing floor 2 or Battlefield.

content:
y 30
												One of the most Over-rated games in history, 7/10It has undoubtedly some amazing graphics, specially when we consider the year of its release, 2007, But graphics alone no matter how good they are don't make a game amazing. It also is open-world FPS which at the time was very innovative, just like the armour system. However though the map is huge it feels empty: Most of the time you're just walking around with nothing to do (some collectibles would have done the trick). The game lacks some stealth-gameplay that the cloak system alone can't deliver, specially since its very weak (only lasts for a few seconds). Plus a thermal scope would have been usefull in that matter. In general its a good game, 7/10, just not as Amazing as people say it is, a bit like Mass effect. Sincerely I still can't believe how COD MW1 and Halo 3 lost the FPS of the year (2007) for this...
